content: 07 r3 single_crochet increase single_crochet x5 08 r4 single_crochet x2 increase single_crochet x5 09 r5 single_crochet x3 increase single_crochet x5 10 r6 single_crochet x4 increase single_crochet x5 11 r7 single_crochet x5 increase single_crochet x5 12 r8 single_crochet x6 increase single_crochet x5 13 r9 single_crochet x7 increase single_crochet x5 14 r10 single_crochet x8 increase single_crochet x5 15 fasten_off leaving an 8-10 tail flatten tail with the increase s centered along the top edge page 2 of 4 copyright august 2021 tail frill using dark pink see images on next page pick up tail leaving a starting tail of a few inches attaching yarn in the bottom edge of r10 with a slip_stitch working between the rounds … ch1 single_crochet x9 ch4 starting in 2nd chain from hook slip_stitch single_crochet half_double_crochet make sure this section is at the end of the tail rotate and work down the opposite of the tail between the rounds single_crochet ch1 x9 fasten_off leaving a tail of a few inches optional lightly stuff tail you do not want a thick tail sew tail over r7-14 making sure the increase s are on the top now take your dark pink tail ends and insert into the body and then bring them back out in the same stitch so that you can securely knot your ends together this gives a finished look where the frill meets the body finishing ~ using black embroidery thread or 2ply yarn whipstitch 2x for a mouth 2 sts wide between r8-9 you can also use some black to highlight the bottom of the mouth with only 1 whipstitch page 3 of 4 copyright august 2021 this pattern and all photos in this document are the property of carrey reynolds @ mixedkreationsdesigns this pattern is for personal use only no unauthorized reproduction in whole or in part or
